channel.title: Vps help I WILL REP!
channel.description:
Before i get started i want to apologize if this is in the wrong section. [shadow=red,left]I HAVE ADDED THE PORTS IN THE FIREWALL![/shadow]
Okay, yesterday i bought vpsland, and got it. Then i transferred all the files normally to the vps and started up the run.bat. When i try and log into the server, it wont let me.. but it still says server is online? Is something blocking it? i need help.. Vpsland keeps saying the same shit all over again.. Do i need to use no-ip? or i use the vps ip?

item.title: Vps help I WILL REP!
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Are you sure your VPS has the port open? Check your access logs and see if it helps… You can’t always trust the support from your provider. They could have done it wrong, or not done it at all. Be sure to double check everything yourself

Read full topic

item.title: Vps help I WILL REP!
item.dc:creator: @ristler123 ristler123
item.description:
@ristler123 wrote:

Wintercanon:

Make sure your server is binding to the IP of the VPS and not 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0.

It is. i really need help…

Read full topic

item.title: Vps help I WILL REP!
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Make sure your server is binding to the IP of the VPS and not 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps help I WILL REP!
item.dc:creator: @ristler123 ristler123
item.description:
@ristler123 wrote:

HcoJustin:

Use the VPS’s IP. There is no need to portforward it, just open the port in your firewall.

Ok, so i just tried using vps ip nothing, it says its online but cant connect.
How do i open the port in firewall? sorry, i’m a noob.
I’m using windows 2003 this is what the dude send me

Hello,

We have opened port no 43594 on your VPS. Also please letus know the type of port no 5555 .We can open TCP port. Due to a recent recurring issue we have been having with UDP floods, we have disabled the UDP ports on all of our servers. This is part of our new security policy.

To open a specific port in the firewall you first need to configure the application on that specific port. After this the port will start listening on the server.

Please let us know if you require any further assistance.

Thanks,
Ryan.

Jaguarpc – 27 Sep 17

VPSLand Merges with JaguarPC - Jaguarpc

What You Can Expect During the Transition First and foremost, all of your servers will remain untouched and online. The merger between VPSLand and JaguarPC will only affect the billing side of your VPSLand account. Instead of logging in at VPSLand,...

Read full topic

item.title: Vps help I WILL REP!
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Use the VPS’s IP. There is no need to portforward it, just open the port in your firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps help I WILL REP!
item.dc:creator: @ristler123 ristler123
item.description:
@ristler123 wrote:

I InDrEk I:

First you have to tell them to portforward your server’s port (Usually 43594), just send em a message.

Yes, i told them and they portforwarded it.

Read full topic
